questions.questionText: Which type of relation in the class diagram affects between classes (and not their instances)?
How can you achieve if there are many classes in a class diagram to make their relationship cleared?
options: We do not indicate the properties of the relationships (multiplicity, role name, etc.)
We print the diagram in a smaller size

questions.questionText: When do we list a method in a derived class, if a method of the same name exists in the parent class?
options: If we declare or override it in the derived class
Only in case of method overriding
If the method does an important activity (not setter / getter, etc.)
questions.correctAnswer: If we declare or override it in the derived class

questions.questionText: When is the method of the parent class visible in the derived class?
options: If we refer to it with the super keyword
If it is public or protected
questions.correctAnswer: If it is public or protected

questions.questionText: What is true about the dependency relation?
options: The dependent object cannot create an instance of the class that generates the dependency

questions.questionText: Which statement is false about generalization?
options: Java allows multiple generalizations, if we do not implement more than one interface
Java does not allow multiple generalization
Generalization is the opposite of specialization
In Java, we express it with the keyword extends
questions.correctAnswer: Java allows multiple generalizations, if we do not implement more than one interface

questions.questionText: What can be a generic parameter in Java?
options: Classes that implement the methods used by the generic
Any type that implements the methods used by the generic
questions.correctAnswer: Classes that implement the methods used by the generic

questions.questionText: Which is considered an abstraction method?
Can a generic class have an abstract method?
Can an abstract class have a generic method?
Which statement is false?
options: The collection groups any amount of data.
The type of data stored in the collection is the same.
In case of primitive types, we can instantiate the collection with the wrapper class of the primitive type.
questions.correctAnswer: The type of data stored in the collection is the same.

questions.questionText: What data members can a static method use within its own class?
What can't we use a static attribute for?
options: For values shared by objects in the class

questions.questionText: What types of exceptions must be caught or indicated?
options: None of the exceptions should be caught or indicated

questions.questionText: How can we define a custom exception?
options: We create an enum which contains the types of errors
We derive our exception type from class Exception
questions.correctAnswer: We derive our exception type from class Exception

questions.questionText: Which statement is false about the serialization implemented by Java Serializable?
options: We can take a snapshot of the objects with it.
Serialization saves both the state and relationships of an object and can deserialize them automatically.
A typical tool to realize Remote Method Invokation (RMI).
We can create a binary representation of the object.
questions.correctAnswer: Serialization saves both the state and relationships of an object and can deserialize them automatically.

questions.questionText: What is the super class of the Swing controls?
Which class represents the window in the Swing environment?
Which method is used to define the behavior, that takes effect when we close the window?
Which pairs can be used to handle window events?
Which statement is true? The window icon file ...
options: ...should be placed inside of the project folder always.
...can be loaded both from the JAR of the program and from the file system the same way.
...loading can be guaranteed to work always, if we place it in the JAR of the program.
...could only be a bmp or ico file.
questions.correctAnswer: ...loading can be guaranteed to work always, if we place it in the JAR of the program.

questions.questionText: Which method can be used to add a mouse click handler to a Swing component?
What should we do if we need to handle multiple types of mouse events?
options: We implement the MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, MouseWheelListener interfaces separately one by one.
We create a class that implements all three interfaces (MouseListener, MouseMotionListener, MouseWheelListener).
We need to add a separate interface implementation for each event.
We derive an event handler class from the MouseAdapter.
questions.correctAnswer: We derive an event handler class from the MouseAdapter.

questions.questionText: What is the basic idea of programs that use event handlers?
options: While the program is running, certain activities are done as a result of events.
The event object must be defined by the event handler.
We can respond to mouse clicks in separate functions.
questions.correctAnswer: While the program is running, certain activities are done as a result of events.

questions.questionText: Which statement is false about the event object?
options: It has a reference to where the event occurred.
The source attribute that contains the source of the event always points to a real object.
Carries the properties of the event.
An appropriate event class can be created for similar types of events.
questions.correctAnswer: The source attribute that contains the source of the event always points to a real object.

questions.questionText: Which statement is false? The event handler function...
options: ...receives as a parameter the triggered event to which it is currently responding.
...contains the activity to be performed in response to that event.
...used only to handle graphic event events.
...can trigger other events while it is running.
questions.correctAnswer: ...used only to handle graphic event events.

questions.questionText: Which statement is true?
options: The ButtonGroup is used to change the style of the assigned Buttons consistently.
No more than one RadioButton can be selected in a JFrame at a time.
ButtonGroup shows the RadioButtons in a visual frame.
RadioButtons are in mutual exclusion when they are assigned to a ButtonGroup.
questions.correctAnswer: RadioButtons are in mutual exclusion when they are assigned to a ButtonGroup.

questions.questionText: The NetBeans designer collects the initialization of visual elements in the following method...
The implementation of the event handler code of a button click can be found in the following interface
Which method of ActionListener should be implemented when we handle a button event?
What is true about the JList control?
options: JList stores the data, that has to be showned.
The default model for JList is DefaultContainerModel.
The type of data stored in the JList model is String.
In the JList control, the selection of an element can be detected via the valueChanged event.
questions.correctAnswer: In the JList control, the selection of an element can be detected via the valueChanged event.

questions.questionText: Which method of JTextField can be used to get the edited text?
Which interface should be implemented if we want to be notified of a change in the value of the Slider?
Which method is used to obtain the content of a BufferedImage to draw on it?
In which method can we redefine the drawing of a Swing UI component?
Which method of Graphics2D can we use to draw? (Which one is an existing method?)
Which statement is part of the Data Query Language?
What is the Connection rollback () method used for?
options: Undoes database changes made since the connection was established.
Undoes the last transaction that was started but not yet committed.
Cancels the last issued change request.
questions.correctAnswer: Undoes the last transaction that was started but not yet committed.

questions.questionText: Which method call is incorrect on the rs variable of type ResultSet?
What do we call as Dirty Read?
options: Reading data stored in the wrong format.
We are requesting too much data from the database manager.

questions.questionText: What is true about a good database?
options: All columns in each table are indexed.
Keys can only consist of a single field.

questions.questionText: What type does JPasswordField use to store data?
Which statement is true about JTable?
options: The table has a data object that implements the TableModel interface.
The data is stored in the JTable.
There is no default (abstract) implementation of TableModel.
The fireTableStructureChanged method only invalidates the table structure.
questions.correctAnswer: The table has a data object that implements the TableModel interface.

questions.questionText: Which methods of TableModel need to be implemented for minimal operation?
To display the JTable, the Cell renderer uses the following type - display pair.

quizzes.topic: UML State Diagrams and Object States

questions.questionText: Which statement is NOT TRUE about the condition?
options: The state has an identifier so it can be distinguished from the others.
The state of the object can be described by the specific values of the attributes.
The state persists as long as the values of the attributes of the objects satisfy the invariant assigned to the state.
The termination of a state can occur suddenly by itself.
questions.correctAnswer: The termination of a state can occur suddenly by itself.

questions.questionText: Which statement is FALSE?
options: When the object terminates, the object enters an out-of-system termination state.
When the object expires, the state of the object is simply cleared.
The termination of the state occurs as a result of an event.
When the state of the object terminates, the object enters another state.
questions.correctAnswer: When the object expires, the state of the object is simply cleared.

questions.questionText: Which statement is true about the state diagram?
options: The nodes of the state diagram graph are events, the edges are state transitions.
The state diagram can contain several initial states.
A state diagram is a singly connected directed graph.
A state diagram is an undirected graph.
questions.correctAnswer: A state diagram is a singly connected directed graph.

questions.questionText: The complexity of the state diagram can be reduced by the following method(s):
Which statement is true?
options: The invariant of the aggregated and generalized states are the same.
The invariant of the aggregated state is the disjunction of state invariants of the sub-states.
The invariant of the generalized state is the disjunction of state invariants of the sub-states.
The invariant of the generalized state is the conjunction of state invariants of the sub-states.
questions.correctAnswer: The invariant of the generalized state is the disjunction of state invariants of the sub-states.

quizzes.topic: UML Activity, Collaboration, and Use Case Diagrams

questions.questionText: How do we mark the rendezvous point on a flowchart like activity diagram?
options: With a rectangle with rounded corners

questions.questionText: In the collaboration diagram, between which objects does the collaboration take place?
options: Which are connected by an association.
Which are instances of the same class.
questions.correctAnswer: Which are connected by an association.

questions.questionText: Which diagram can be considered as an extension of the collaboration diagram?
How do we mark the argument passed in the collaboration diagram during message sending?
options: With the envelope icon on the association.
With a small arrow starts from a circle.
With the message ID associated with the association.
With the arrow pointing from the sender to the recipient.
questions.correctAnswer: With a small arrow starts from a circle.

questions.questionText: How do we mark on a collaboration diagram if a message has multiple recipients?
options: With several arrows indicated on the association.
The recipients are indicated by three rectangles that are shifted relative to each other.
We do not have the opportunity to do that.
questions.correctAnswer: The recipients are indicated by three rectangles that are shifted relative to each other.

questions.questionText: Which is NOT a part of the user case diagram?
How do we mark the user case on the user case diagram?
options: By making the name of the use case underlined

questions.questionText: Which one is false? Requirements elicitation and analysis can be more difficult because ...
options: customers are direct users of the software.
customers do not have IT skills.
customers do not clearly express their expectations.
questions.correctAnswer: customers are direct users of the software.

questions.questionText: Which relation type is not part of the use case diagram?
Which one is not a non-functional requirement?
What is the structure of the user story?
options: GIVEN environment WHEN activity THEN effect
USER user IN USE CASE use case WITH RELATION relation
AS A role USE function TO goal
WHEN activity APPLYING function IN ORDER TO goal
questions.correctAnswer: GIVEN environment WHEN activity THEN effect

questions.questionText: Which statement is false about the design phases?
options: Existing classes can be further specified at each stage.
Classes that become complex can be split up to less complex classes.
We can introduce new classes in each phase.
We need to put functionally fragmented classes into one package.
questions.correctAnswer: We need to put functionally fragmented classes into one package.

questions.questionText: How many principles should we follow according to the SOLID principle?
What is software architecture?
options: The way software is deployed to the hardware architecture.
A set of primary design decisions made during software development.
The class structure from which we build the package diagram.
questions.correctAnswer: A set of primary design decisions made during software development.

questions.questionText: For which architecture is it most difficult to separate the functions of the program?
What can't be a program component?
Which one is not part of the system plan?
Which SOLID principle makes it possible to implement the polymorphism?
Which statement is false about the Single Responsibility Principle?
options: Excessive use of SRP can break the program structure.
Facilitates loose connection of program units.
If the SRP principle is violated, so is the Open / Closed Principle.
A program unit can have only one responsibility.
questions.correctAnswer: If the SRP principle is violated, so is the Open / Closed Principle.

questions.questionText: Which statement is false? The Liskov substitution principle ...
options: ... prohibits extending the type of exceptions.
... expects a covariance of return values.

questions.questionText: Which statement is true for the Inverse Dependencies principle?
options: The object instantiates the classes directly on its own.
We should not transform concrete classes.
Specific classes communicate with each other through abstraction.
Class fields contain instances of specific classes.
questions.correctAnswer: Specific classes communicate with each other through abstraction.

questions.questionText: How can we NOT inject dependency?
options: Using an interface where the client realizes the setter method.

questions.questionText: What is not appropriate to use tickets in a project management tool?
What does a ticket not specify?
options: The responsible person for the task

questions.questionText: Which statement is false about version control systems?
options: We can use it to store all previous program versions.
With its use, we do not need to deal with conflicts.
questions.correctAnswer: With its use, we do not need to deal with conflicts.

questions.questionText: Which statement applies to distributed version control systems?
options: Known implementations e.g. CVS, SVN, SourceSafe
Communication is peer-to-peer, but it is possible to set up dedicated servers.
Concurrency management is typically done by merging before submission.
questions.correctAnswer: Communication is peer-to-peer, but it is possible to set up dedicated servers.

questions.questionText: With which command in git can we synchronize the new version created in our local storage to remote storage?
Which statement is true about verification?
options: Dynamic analysis is not suitable for measuring program performance.
Dynamic analysis can reveal errors resulting from program unit interactions.
Static analysis can be performed only when the full program code is known.
Despite the static analysis, it is not guaranteed that the errors will be covered by each other.
questions.correctAnswer: Dynamic analysis can reveal errors resulting from program unit interactions.

questions.questionText: Testing ...
options: ... is used to search for runtime errors, abnormalities, compatibility issues.
... guarantees that the program is error free.
... guarantees that the program is valid in all circumstances.
... aims to detect errors at compile time.
questions.correctAnswer: ... is used to search for runtime errors, abnormalities, compatibility issues.

questions.questionText: Which statement is true?
options: The user test typically consists of black box tests.
The developer test typically consists of black box tests.
The release test is performed by the development team.
The smoke test is performed by measuring the amount of smoke rising from the power supply unit.
questions.correctAnswer: The user test typically consists of black box tests.

questions.questionText: The correct order of developer test steps is:
options: unit test, system test, integration test
integration test, unit test, system test
system test, integration test, unit test
unit test, integration test, system test
questions.correctAnswer: unit test, integration test, system test

questions.questionText: Which statement is false?
options: The first step in integration and system testing is the smoke test.
The amount of program code tested by test collections is called code coverage.
During the release test and the user test, the software should usually work with actual data in the target environment.
The release test does not include deployment (e.g. installation).
questions.correctAnswer: The release test does not include deployment (e.g. installation).

questions.questionText: Which task does the build system not perform?
options: Automatically upload changed project files to a version tracker
questions.correctAnswer: Automatically upload changed project files to a version tracker

questions.questionText: Which one is not a build system?
What is the name of the Maven build system project file?
What is the abbreviation for GAV in the Maven system?
Which statement is true about the content of pom.xml?
options: modelVersion: the version number of the model layer of the application
artifactId: unique name of the project
version: the minimum Maven version required for translation
groupId: the ID of the module development team within the company
questions.correctAnswer: artifactId: unique name of the project

questions.questionText: The goal of continuous integration is ...
options: ... storage and retrieval of program versions.
... immediate, automated filtering of possible bugs, integration problems, feedback to developers.
... automatic delivery of the created software to the users.
... transforming a code consisting of several smaller parts into a larger, coherent code base.
questions.correctAnswer: ... immediate, automated filtering of possible bugs, integration problems, feedback to developers.

questions.questionText: The goal of continuous delivery is ...
options: ... ensuring continuous interaction of self-organizing, small teams with quick feedback.
... implementing rapid application development on an incremental basis.
... so that the program codes can be stored in a central repository several times a day using a version control system.
questions.correctAnswer: ... implementing rapid application development on an incremental basis.

questions.questionText: What do we call the interdependent tasks of continuous integration and continuous delivery?
In what language can the Git CI / CD configuration be described?
Which of the following is not related to continuous integration?
Which is NOT part of the three rules of the TDD?
options: Write just enough of a test to demonstrate the error.
DO NOT encode anything except what is necessary for our program to pass the failed test.
Successful testing is always followed by refactoring.
Write only as much code as is sufficient for a successful test.
questions.correctAnswer: Successful testing is always followed by refactoring.

questions.questionText: What is true about TDD?
options: The final code should work well enough in the last test cases introduced.
It is enough to encode only what is needed at the moment.
The tests cover only a subset of possible uses.
As a result, we get a structured code that satisfies the tests but still needs to be refactored.
questions.correctAnswer: The tests cover only a subset of possible uses.

questions.questionText: What features are typical of Clean Code?
options: Easy to read, no repetition, testable

questions.questionText: What is NOT a typical reason for the constant change in the code?
Which concept is part of the Clean Code?
options: The break and continue statements should be used with caution.
Do not use the same name for different purposes
questions.correctAnswer: Do not use the same name for different purposes

questions.questionText: Which statement is false about the methods in the Clean Code?
options: A method can implement multiple levels of abstraction.
Blocks must have a clear entry and exit point (break, continue is not allowed).
The implementation should fit on one screen.
Do not repeat ourselves in the code (DRY).
questions.correctAnswer: A method can implement multiple levels of abstraction.

questions.questionText: Which statement is true about the Clean Code?
options: Functions can simultaneously answer a question and perform something.
The comment helps you understand the hard-to-understand code.
We use both error codes and exceptions.
Code and comment do not necessarily coexist.
questions.correctAnswer: Code and comment do not necessarily coexist.

questions.questionText: Which thread runs the activities responsible for event handling?
Which thread state does not exist?
What is the default priority of threads?
Which method of the Thread object can be used to start a new thread?
Which method can a thread use to give its CPU time to other threads?
Which method of a thread can be called to wait for the thread to complete?
What does starvation mean in a parallel environment?
options: Threads do not give up their used resources.
By the time the program is willing to complete, the user has long starved to death.
The threads in the parallel program cannot start because the operating system was previously in a zombie state.
A thread cannot access the desired resource for an extended period of time because other long-running threads receive it earlier.
questions.correctAnswer: A thread cannot access the desired resource for an extended period of time because other long-running threads receive it earlier.

questions.questionText: An object is used as a lock. Which method of it can be used to wake up a thread, that is waiting for that object?
What is true for an immutable object?
options: The state of the object cannot be changed after the constructor has run.
Its attributes can only be changed using setter methods.
Its attributes cannot be changed in the object. But, in case of references, it is allowed on the objects accessible through them.
We cannot store a reference to other objects in the object.
questions.correctAnswer: The state of the object cannot be changed after the constructor has run.

questions.questionText: Which one is a NON-EXISTING group of design patterns?
Which design pattern was classified in the wrong class?
With which design pattern can we reduce the required memory by sharing the common parts of the state among several objects in a new object?
Which design pattern provides a simplified interface to a library, framework, etc.?
Which design pattern translates a class interface to another compatible interface?
Which design pattern allows requests to be forwarded along the chain of handlers?
Which design pattern can reduce dependencies between objects?
Which design pattern allows you to iterate over the items of a collection without knowing how to represent the elements?

Sequence diagrams illustrate interactions between objects on a time axis going from the top to the bottom of the diagram. The lifeline of an object is the dashed line. The messages passed (that is, the method calls) between the objects are shown as the arrows. On the figure the arrows denote locking resources. We know that both threads need both resources. At which method call can we be sure that there is a deadlock?
What will be the result of calling the wait() method of an object if the calling thread doesn't possess the monitor lock?
What is the default priority of threads?
options: Default priority of a thread is 5 (NORM_PRIORITY)
questions.correctAnswer: Default priority of a thread is 5 (NORM_PRIORITY)

questions.questionText: Which possible outputs can this running code produce?
What will be the result when running this code?
What will be the result when running this code?
Which of these are atomic operations?
Which statement is true of this code?
options: We can make the class thread-safe, if we make the run method synchronized.
We can make the class thread-safe, if we make the foo method static.
This code throws an exception at runtime.

questions.questionText: Which of these statements about immutable classes is not true?
options: The class should be final to avoid inheritance.
All the attributes of the class should be declared as private final.
We have to make a copy of the objects stored in attributes, when we return it in a getter method.
The class should not contain any kind of methods, that change the state after the constructor.
questions.correctAnswer: All the attributes of the class should be declared as private final.

questions.questionText: Which of these SQL statements are DML statements?
options: update [table] set ..., delete from [table] ..., insert into [table] ...
questions.correctAnswer: update [table] set ..., delete from [table] ..., insert into [table] ...

questions.questionText: Which of these is an incorrect way to access the data in a ResultSet?
What information cannot be obtained from the SQLException object?
options: Description of the error that occurred.

questions.questionText: Which of the following statements is true?(If it has option D then D is correct if not A is correct)
options: CallableStatement extends the PreparedStatement interface. This interface can be used to call SQL stored procedures.
Statement extends the PreparedStatement interface and is used when the SQL query does not need to be run multiple times.
PreparedStatement is used to start static queries (eg select * from table), therefore PreparedStatements cannot be parameterize
Batch processing of SQL statements is possible using PreparedStatement.
CallableStatement extends the PreparedStatement interface. This interface can be used to call SQL stored procedures., Batch processing of SQL statements is possible using PreparedStatement.
questions.correctAnswer: CallableStatement extends the PreparedStatement interface. This interface can be used to call SQL stored procedures., Batch processing of SQL statements is possible using PreparedStatement.

questions.questionText: Which of the following statements is true?
options: PreparedStatement extends the CallableStatement interface. This interface can be used to call SQL stored procedures.
Statement extends the PreparedStatement interface and is used when the SQL query does not need to be run multiple times.
PreparedStatement is used to start static queries (eg select * from table), therefore PreparedStatements cannot be parameterized.
Batch processing of SQL statements is possible using PreparedStatement.
questions.correctAnswer: Batch processing of SQL statements is possible using PreparedStatement.

questions.questionText: How to start a new database transaction?
options: By requesting a Transaction object from Connection and calling that begin () method.
By requesting a Transaction object from Connection and setting its autoCommit property to false.
By calling the beginTransaction method of the Connection.
By setting the autoCommit property of the Connection to false and executing an SQL statement.
questions.correctAnswer: By setting the autoCommit property of the Connection to false and executing an SQL statement.

questions.questionText: When do we use the transaction on databases?
Which connection is usually interpreted with a connection table?
Which one is not part of the Entity-Relationship diagram?
Which one is not true about the relationship between JTable and the model?
options: The model cannot notify JTable of the change
The representation of the model may differ from the data queried by JTable
questions.correctAnswer: The model cannot notify JTable of the change

questions.questionText: What are the principal quality metrics of software?
options: Delivery time, implementation cost, hardware and software requirements.
Ergonomics, usability, compatibility, hardware and software requirements.

questions.questionText: Which of these is the structure of a user story?
options: USER … IN USE CASE … WITH RELATION …

questions.questionText: What is the correct order of requirements analysis steps?
options: feasibility analysis, requirement exploration, requirement specification, requirement validation
requirement exploration, requirement specification, requirement validation, feasibility analysis
requirement exploration, requirement validation, requirement specification, feasibility analysis
requirement exploration, requirement specification, feasibility analysis, requirement validation
questions.correctAnswer: feasibility analysis, requirement exploration, requirement specification, requirement validation

questions.questionText: Which of these is not a software development process?
Which of these are the relations of a UML use case diagram?
What is the UML deployment diagram used for?
options: Describe the sequence of steps required to install the software on a given machine.
It depicts all the error possibilities that you may encounter during installation.
Describe the software components according to how to install them in an installation package.
Depict the physical placement of software components (on different machines) with the required software environment.
questions.correctAnswer: Depict the physical placement of software components (on different machines) with the required software environment.

questions.questionText: Which OOP design principle is violated by the singleton design pattern? The singleton pattern guarantees that there is only a single instance created from a class which can be accessed through a static method.
Which of these techniques can be used to implement dependency inversion?
What is Test Driven Development (TDD)?
options: A software development method in which tests are written before the actual program code is written.
Test method to ensure that test cases cover all program units and are performed in the appropriate order.
A general principle that states that all instructions in program code should be verified using unit tests (100% code coverage).

A testing method in which unit tests are first performed on classes (and their methods), then integration tests are used to check the combined behavior of the classes, and finally system tests are used to check the behavior of the entire software.
questions.correctAnswer: A software development method in which tests are written before the actual program code is written.

questions.questionText: Which the following features is not provided by unit testing frameworks?
options: Create manual test cases in separate program units (classes).
Generate test cases automatically, that covers all scenarios, by analyzing the code.
Assert statements, which compare the expected and the return values.
Creation of test reports, which lists the passed/failed tests.
questions.correctAnswer: Generate test cases automatically, that covers all scenarios, by analyzing the code.

questions.questionText: In the case of Unit testing, the parts of the program must be separated from each other and boundaries must be established between them. One possible solution to this is to use objects that mimic the behavior of other objects. What are these objects called?
What is the starting point of object-oriented design?
How do we express that an object is related to several objects of a class?
Which of these can we assign constraints to on a class diagram?
Which of these relations is between classes?
Which diagram is not part of the dynamic model?
What cannot have a state on a state diagram?
Which method can reduce the complexity of the state diagram?
Which statement is true?
options: The invariant of generalization is the disjunction of the invariants of states
The invariant of generalization is the conjunction of the invariants of states
The invariant of aggregation is the disjunction of the invariants of states
The states obtained by the two methods have no invariant
questions.correctAnswer: The invariant of generalization is the disjunction of the invariants of states

questions.questionText: Which diagrams are part of the static model?
Based on the following implementation, which relationship exists exactly between the car and the engine?
What is the relationship between the Person and Phone classes in the class diagram below?
What kind of methods do we have to implement when we would like to use instances of our own class as keys in a HashMap?

Which of the following options should you choose if you want to apply mainly an index-based search to a dynamically changing data set where the same element can occur more than once? (We only want to add a new item to the end of the collection, we don't want to delete it from the collection often.)

Which implementation to choose from the following options if you want to use a collection that does not contain duplicate items and you do not need to store the items in the order of insertion or in ascending order of values?
Which of the following implementations of interfaces are used to store key-value pairs?
Which of these statements is true?
options: A final abstract class must have at least one abstract method
An abstract class has at least one abstract method
All the attributes of a final class are final
The derived class of an abstract class can be also abstract
questions.correctAnswer: The derived class of an abstract class can be also abstract

questions.questionText: Which of these statements is false?
options: We cannot derive from a final class
A class can implement multiple interfaces
We have to implement all methods of the interface in a final class

questions.questionText: Which of these can be a generic parameter?
options: Class, that implements the methods used in the generic
questions.correctAnswer: Class, that implements the methods used in the generic

questions.questionText: Which collection can be indexed?
What can be static in JAVA?
What does Java support about multiple specialization and multiple generalizations?
Which of the following is not an agile principle?
options: Prefer the methodology instead of the tools
Prefer the operating software instead of a comprehensive documentation
Prefer cooperation with the client instead of enforcing the contractual negotiations
Prefer responding to changes instead of following the plan.
questions.correctAnswer: Prefer the methodology instead of the tools

questions.questionText: Which statement is not true about the sprint?
options: The product is all designed, coded and tested within the sprint.
The result of the sprint is a working code representing business value.
Once tasks and times have been defined, only the product owner will be involved in the work of the team.
The Scrum team works in a self-organizing way throughout the sprint.
questions.correctAnswer: Once tasks and times have been defined, only the product owner will be involved in the work of the team.

questions.questionText: Which statement is true for the Scrum Master?
options: Scrum Master is the manager of the Scrum team
The Scrum Master leads the daily Scrum
Scrum Master is not responsible for protecting the work of the SCRUM team from outside influences
Scrum Master is responsible for the processes
questions.correctAnswer: Scrum Master is responsible for the processes

questions.questionText: Which statement is true for daily Scrum?
options: The daily Scrum is led by the Scrum Master.
During the daily Scrum, team members report to the Scrum Master on their progress.
During the daily Scrum, the goal is to remove obstacles that affect the team.
The daily Scrum can last up to 15 minutes.
questions.correctAnswer: The daily Scrum can last up to 15 minutes.

questions.questionText: Test-driven development (TDD) is a software development methodology according to which…
options: the tests must be written before the actual program code is implemented.
tests must be performed on each unit after the actual program code has been implemented.
new program code can be implemented after approval by the test colleague.
the test report must be assigned to the documentation one day before the implementation of the new program code.
questions.correctAnswer: the tests must be written before the actual program code is implemented.

questions.questionText: What is the purpose of the continuous integration (CI) practical method?
options: Immediate, automated filtering of possible errors and integration problems, feedback to the developer. (Self-check build)
Automatically re-run failed integration tests until they are repaired.
Facilitates the transition to an object-oriented programming language.
questions.correctAnswer: Immediate, automated filtering of possible errors and integration problems, feedback to the developer. (Self-check build)

questions.questionText: What are the disadvantages of centralized version control systems (Example: SVN, Perforce, CVS)?
options: The privileged role of the server. (In the event of a failure, the system becomes unusable until the server is repaired.) In addition, version control requires a network connection.
Concurrency management realized by exclusive locks.
questions.correctAnswer: The privileged role of the server. (In the event of a failure, the system becomes unusable until the server is repaired.) In addition, version control requires a network connection.

questions.questionText: Which statement is not true for distributed version control systems (Example: Git, Mercurial)?
options: A decentralized, distributed network model is used, where concurrency management is typically done through post-submission merging.
Each client has a complete repository and version history. The operations of the revision management tool take place locally on the client's storage.
Communication is peer-to-peer, but it is also possible to set up dedicated servers.
A set of file-based operations is typical, where concurrency management is typically done by merging before submission.
questions.correctAnswer: Communication is peer-to-peer, but it is also possible to set up dedicated servers.

questions.questionText: Is it true that there can be no conflict with Git merge?
options: True, as conflict can only occur with rebase.
False, because there is a conflict between colleagues for every merge.
True, since each merge is also another commit.
False, as git may not be able to resolve changes automatically. (Example: Two different commits tores a change on the same line in a file.)
questions.correctAnswer: False, as git may not be able to resolve changes automatically. (Example: Two different commits tores a change on the same line in a file.)

questions.questionText: Which of the following are the build tools?

quizzes.topic: DRY Principle, SOLID Principles, and Design Patterns

questions.questionText: What does the DRY principle say?
options: Don't implement code in advance that "will need it in the future" because we will almost certainly never need it.
Each piece of knowledge must have a single, clear and reliable representation within a system.
Perfection is not best approached when we can no longer add anything to a system, but when we do not know what to take from it.
It is safe to say that the quality of our code base will improve if we always leave our current code there a little "better", a little cleaner than we found it.
questions.correctAnswer: Each piece of knowledge must have a single, clear and reliable representation within a system.

questions.questionText: Which object-oriented principle is violated in the code snippet below?
Which of the following is not a SOLID principle?
Which object-oriented principle is violated in the code snippet below?

Given a Lamp class. The lamp has a color and can be switched on / off. In our apartment there is a switch on the wall, which was implemented as follows. What could be the problem with this implementation?
options: The switch violates the Liskov Substitution Principle
The switch violates the Open/Closed Principle
The switch is at a higher abstraction level than the lamp, so it violates the Dependency Inversion Principle
The switch violates the Single Responsibility Principle
questions.correctAnswer: The switch is at a higher abstraction level than the lamp, so it violates the Dependency Inversion Principle

questions.questionText: Which design pattern provides a solution to the problem of notifying multiple objects when another object changes state.
Which design pattern can be used to avoid constructors with long parameter lists?

Which design pattern can we use if we want to provide an interface for creating a family of related or interdependent objects without specifying a specific class?
Which design pattern can be used in case we want to transfer the instantiation of a given class to the corresponding subclasses?
Which design pattern does the following code snippet implement?
